law.text: All persons employing persons in mining work shall, on or before the fifteenth and thirtieth days of each month pay to each employee, within fifteen (15) days of the aforesaid fifteenth or thirtieth day, respectively, in lawful money of the United States, the full amount of wages due him, unless prevented by an unavoidable casualty. If, at any time of payment, the employee is absent from his place of labor he shall be entitled to such payment at any reasonable time thereafter on demand.
law.history: Amended 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 303, sec. 49. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2738r-1.
